entry.title: WotD71 - Epiphany
entry.content:
When I was teaching, we talked about the joy of a lightbulb moment, that point where a kind has the kind of 'a-ha' realisation that changes the nature of their understanding.

It's a very attractive idea, that someone can be inspired, visited by the muse, or inspired by us as teachers to have an epiphany.

Now I'm certain that those moments come from the hard work, that they only happen when we've laid the foundations, done the preparation, slogged our guts out for the work.

Shame!

entry.title: WotD68 - Nefarious
entry.content:
I'm not sure I believe in evil, I certainly don't believe that people are badly intentioned.

On the other hand I do believe that people carry round with them masses of hurt and insecurity. That those hurts and insecurities are often the source of their poor choices and challenging behaviours.

Not sure that there are any easy answers, but maybe that's the start of wisdom.

entry.title: WotD70 - Limerence
entry.content:
Limerence is the state of being infatuated, the delightful feeling that we can't live without someone or something.

Infatuation is short-lived. Biologically it exists as a stepping stone to something more long-lived, the dopamine high, wears off and we are left with a choice. Love for work, love for an idea, love for a person, they all require us to make a choice, to take action, to take care of our relationship with the thing.

Of course, modern story-telling rejoices in the infatuation phase, there are a million stories and songs about the act of falling in love and being saved by it. There is very little celebrating the act of choosing to love someone day after day, even when that's difficult...

After all finding a way to carry on expressing out love is the ultimate act of creativity.

Today's #PositivePostIt word is #Limerence #Love #Infatuation #Blog http://helenwalker.net/2015/10/04/wotd70-limerence/

entry.title: WotD67 - Plague
entry.content:
Today's word plague instantly reminded me of Mercutio from Romeao and Juliet, famously cursing his friend, Romeo's, family and Juliet's...

ask for me to-morrow, and you shall find me a grave man. I am peppered, I warrant, for this world. A plague o'both your houses! 'Zounds, a dog, a rat, a mouse, a cat, to scratch a man to death! a braggart, a rogue, a villain, that fights by the book of arithmetic! Why the devil came you between us? I was hurt under your arm.

Mercutio is Romeo's mate, they hang out and talk about girls. Mercutio is a lot less enamoured with the idea of love than Romeo, so it's not really a surprise that when Romeo falls for, and quickly marries Juliet in secret, he doesn't tell his friend. This means when Juliet's cousin challenges Romeo to a dual, not only does Romeo not want to fight him, Mercutio thinks that Romeo is being a bit rubbish.

Mercutio fights in Romeo's stead:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MiBKaDlXVYc

Mercutio dies at the hands of Tybalt which drives the play towards inevitable tragedy.

You can understand Mercutio's anger, it's easy to be angry when other people let us down, or when bad things happen by chance. The question is, when the anger subsides, what do you do next?

entry.title: WotD66 - Googleplex
entry.content:
I'm not sure whether the word was intended to be googolplex or Googleplex.

A googol is a really big number:

10,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000,000. A googolplex is a really, really, really, big number.

 

 

 

 

 

 

On the other hand the Googleplex is the headquarters of Google. Famously a workplace designed to be stimulating and creative; to foster great teams and make collaboration happen.

And I'm certain that the design, layout and decoration of our workplaces has a huge impact on how creative we feel, how well we work together, how we feel about work. Which is all well and good, except most of us feel powerless to change our working environment.

And while you might not be able to choose the office layout, or the colour of the walls, you can find a way to add a bit of personality to the environment, to make baby steps towards making a place you do your best work. Maybe it's a reminder of a piece of work, maybe it's a personal totem, maybe it's a book, a pen or a pot plant.

Maybe you can add one thing tomorrow.

entry.title: WotD65 - Brain
entry.content:
Our brains are a remarkable things, each one is utterly unique, they start that way when we get our lump of grey matter and then we redesign it with by living through our experiences and practicing our skills.

Our brains are amazing, and flawed. But for all our unique qualities and attributes there are some things that we all have in common, things that make us human. We all need to be part of a community, to experience the empathy of others. We need to be seen, valued, acknowledged.

All of us sometimes fall into the trap of thinking those areas of commonality are much larger than they are, that our values, our beliefs or our thinking patterns are the same. We talk to people and imagine that they see the world the same as us, that we understand ideas in the same way. We have conversations convinced that we've talked about the same thing, but in reality the words we were using meant different things or the intentions that we thought were the same were entirely different.

Today's #PositivePostIt word is #Brain #Blog http://helenwalker.net/2015/09/29/wotd65-brain/

A photo posted by Helen Walker (@h313n1w) on Sep 29, 2015 at 11:25am PDT

Exploring what we share with others is a good start. Understanding the ways in which we are the same and the ways in which we are different is the start of empathy.

entry.title: WotD64 - Zombie
entry.content:
One of the ways I think that great managers are different is that they're not afraid of talent. They understand that while the poor performers demand a lot of attention, they should fight to recruit talent to their teams and their project teams.

Of course there are challenges to managing talent. And you need to work hard to help them use their talent in the most productive way. But too many managers fail to appoint people because they might move on in 2 years or they might be using the role as a stepping stone. To which I say, 'so what'. Put your big girl (or boy) pants and enjoy the ride.

Help them find projects that stretch them...

Help them manage the waves that they make...

Back them up...

entry.title: WotD63 - Power
entry.content:
I see so many misunderstandings of power. From those that believe they don't have any, those that think their power comes from their position in the hierarchy or their muscle mass.

The main one I see is a failure to recognise our role in empowering others. When we coach them, ask them questions, trust them to solve their own problems, allow them to use their expertise we add value to our community as well as affecting change.

True power comes from service, from the vulnerability of not having all the answers, from honouring the uniqueness of others and allowing them to shine. If you have to wield your power as a threat to others, then all you have is short-term power.

Today's #PositivePostIt word is #Power #Influence #Blog http://helenwalker.net/2015/09/27/wotd63-power/

entry.title: WotD62 - Purple
entry.content:
I love the colour purple.  The actual colour not the book...

So #Purple

A photo posted by Helen Walker (@h313n1w) on Sep 27, 2015 at 12:08pm PDT

Why should you care about that? Well only because I think that when life is a bit crappy, as it sometimes is, you have to know what simple small things are going to make you 5% cheerier.   

#Pretty #Purple #HappyMemories

A photo posted by Helen Walker (@h313n1w) on Jul 23, 2014 at 3:27pm PDT </div> </blockquote>

And more than happier, it's good to know what things are a link to your authenticity. Because goodness knows sometimes the world wants to drag you away from your centre and make you more ordinary, so you fit in better. But the truth is that you are a better you when you celebrate your uniqueness. 

If it's not purple, then what is it? Find it, celebrate it, put it on a t-shirt or in your wallet.

entry.title: WotD61 - Art
entry.content:
There are so many lovely quotations about art, today's post seems somewhat futile...

So here's a selection, pick your favourite and go make some art. I know it's scary, but art is a big old word it covers a whole world of things... Take a risk. You know you want to!

Seth Godin...

If you are willing to do something that might not work, you are closer to being an artist.

Today's #PositivePostIt word was #Art not #indecision despite my giddiness... #Inspiration #Quote #Blog http://helenwalker.net/2015/09/25/wotd61-art/

A photo posted by Helen Walker (@h313n1w) on Sep 25, 2015 at 10:32am PDT

Jean Anouilh...

The object of art is to give life a shape.

Edgar Degas...

Art is not what you see, it is what you make others see.

Indecision... #PositivePostItNotes part 1

A photo posted by Helen Walker (@h313n1w) on Sep 25, 2015 at 10:25am PDT </div> </blockquote>

Frederich Nietzche...

No artist tolerates reality.

Ralph Waldo Emmerson...

Every artist was first an amateur.

#PositivePostIt indecision... Part2 #Quote #Blog

A photo posted by Helen Walker (@h313n1w) on Sep 25, 2015 at 10:27am PDT

Leonardo da Vinci...

Art is never finished, it is only abandoned.
